content:
Question to maintainers (and this topic might be as good as any to initiate this discussion):

It seems we get a lot of questions about where people can contribute to CSLib and there is already quite a bit of work to be done in automata theory. Would it not be a good idea to use the project dashboard approach from the equational theories project to post reasonably proximate tasks that newcomers can pick up?
A message was moved here from #CSLib > Automata by Fabrizio Montesi.

Thanks for the pointer! I'm looking into what possibilities there are for maintaining a public overview/roadmap, but haven't really settled on anything yet, so discussing this is very valuable. In fact, I'm also trying to figure out requirements. (I've seen a similar discussion on #FLT once, I think.)

For now what I'm looking at the most is sane ways to maintain GitHub projects (issues can then link to larger pages in the repository or external websites, describing roadmaps).
